result.execSummary:
The defendant Justin M Flannery was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse Assessments], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: If the defendant completes all of the requirements of probation prior to the 6 months, the agent may petition the court for early release.

miscConds.notes:
Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges during the period of probation; civil judgment if not paid.
Pay supervision fees.
No contact with victim unless approved by the court.

Complete a course in anger management.
Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.

records.addlTxt:
Exhibits received and inventoried this date.  
Box 667
cf
Request for payment of $34 witness fees for witness Denise J. F. processed and forwarded to the Treasurer's Office on check request x26213812 in court 2x on 8/19/15, 8/20/15.
Witness fee request prepared for Denise J. F. will be forwarded to DAs Victim/Witness Services for approval.

Defendant Justin M Flannery in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
Statements by each counsel and defendant as to sentencing.  
Court sentenced the defendant to serve 20 days in the House of Correction with credit for 1 day served.  Court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on probation for up to 6 months with the following conditions:
- Complete a course in anger management.
- Attend treatment and/or counseling as determined.
- No contact with victim unless approved by the court.
- No contact with firearms.
- Pay DV surcharge plus all other costs and surcharges during the period of probation; civil judgment if not paid.
- Pay supervision fees.
 
If the defendant completes all of the requirements of probation prior to the 6 months, the agent may petition the court for early release.
.
Received and filed: Pretrial Sentence Credit, Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation. 
Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition.

Defendant Justin M Flannery in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
.
Parties are back in court to continue with the trial. 
Court ordered the witnesses sequestered.
Sworn for the Plaintiff: Denise F., Zachary Scott, Police Officer, West Allis Police Department., Brent M. and Debra S.  Exhibits 1 and 2 offered and received.
Plaintiff rests subject to rebuttal.
The defendant does not wish to testify. Defendants rest.  Plaintiffs rest.  Testimony closed.  
Defense motions to dismiss at the end of the state's case is denied by the court.  
.
Court adjourned for the lunch hour....
.
Parties back in court, same appearances.
Jury back in box at 1:45 p.m.
 Defense rests.  
Testimony closed.  Closing arguments by counsel.  Court instructs jury.  Milwaukee County Sheriff Deputies Thomas Antkowski and Randal Takacs sworn to take charge of the jury.  Jury retired to deliberate at  the hour of 2:45 p.m..  Jury in the box at 03:40 p.m.and by Foreperson brought in a verdict of GUILTY which was then read in open court.  Clerk polled the jury and each juror acknowledged the correctness of the verdict.  Jury verdict received and filed.  Jury discharged.  State's motion for judgment on the verdict granted.  Defense motion for judgment notwithstanding the verdict denied.  Exhibit list received and filed.  Court orders case adjourned for sentencing to Branch 36 on 09-16-2015 at 08:30 a.m.

Defendant Justin M Flannery in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
cab
  Jury panel in court.  Voir dire proceeded at the hour of  03:35 p.m..  
Twelve (12) good and lawful citizens of the County of Milwaukee, WI qualified to serve as jurors in the above entitled cause were duly impanelled and sworn.  Jury list received and filed.  Court ordered witnesses sequestered.  Court instructed jury.  
Opening statements by state and defense.  
Trial will proceed at 09:00 a.m. tomorrow morning.
  Jury trial scheduled for August 20, 2015 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Justin M Flannery in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  William T. Berens appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
The parties are ready to proceed to trial.
Case passed until this afternoon....

Defendant Justin M Flannery in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Benjamin Lindsay appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
cab
Court advised defendant that the offer is revoked. Case remains set for jury trial in Br. 36 on 08/19/2015 at 08:30 a.m.

Defendant Justin M Flannery in court with attorney Francisco Araiza.  Sarra Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defense counsel requests case be set for Final Pretrial & Jury Trial.  Court informed parties that any motions must be filed 20 DAYS in advance of the Jury Trial date. Parties are notified that effective August 3, 2015 this case will be reassigned per rotation to a branch of the Circuit Court to be determined.  Status conference conducted.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 6, 2015 at 08:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for August 19, 2015 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Justin M Flannery in court. Owen M. Piotrowski appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case heard off the record. Defendant in court PRO SE. Received & Filed, Letter from SPD, defendant eligible. Neither party requests to address the court on the record. Signed, Filed & Distributed, Agreed Upon Request for A New Court Date form. Case is adjourned for a Status of Counsel date to allow SPD to appoint counsel.  Status conference scheduled for April 30, 2015 at 08:30 am.
Cash bail that was previously posted to remain.Oral No Weapons Order  Pre-trial conference scheduled for 04-09-2015 at 01:30 pm.

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Denise F. or her residence or place of employment

Defendant Justin M Flannery in court.  Ann R. López appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Defendant is advised that this case is assigned to Judge Grady, Branch 23.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant received a copy of the complaint and was advised of right to counsel and maximum penalties.  Court entered a plea of not guilty on behalf of the Defendant.  Court reserves Defendant's right to file a substitution of judge pursuant to Sec. 971.20 until Defendant's next scheduled court appearance. 
Defendant was given a referral to the Public Defender's Office. Defendant MAY be Public Defender eligible. The case is adjourned for a Pretrial Conference in Br.23.vb
